discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
No GRE in the ACI and the only correct statement is that the tunnel interface using jumbo MTU.

Answer C:
GRE is not used in ACI, the encap of VXLAN is stated in the output.
Only answer can be C Jumbo Frame (MTU 9000)

questions.question_text: An engineer is configuring a Cisco ACI fabric and requires a shared L3Out network connectivity to external networks. The connectivity must be shared between different tenants. Which tenant type must be created to meet this requirement?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
A. common tenant

questions.question_text: A customer plans to deploy a Cisco ACI Multi-Pod deployment. Which two features must be implemented on the IPN switches?

choices.D:
Configure PIM anycast RP.
Configure a maximum multicast range of /15.
choices.B:
Enable BIDIR-PIM.
Configure a maximum multicast range of /23.
choices.A:
Enable BIDIR-PIM.
Configure a minimum multicast range of /15.
choices.C:
Configure PIM anycast RP.
Configure a minimum multicast range of /23.

questions.question_text:
DRAG DROP -
A leaf receives unicast traffic that is destined to an unknown source, and spine proxy is enabled in the corresponding bridge domain. Drag and drop the Cisco ACI forwarding operations from the left into the order the operation occurs on the right.
Select and Place:
//IMG//

comments.content:
I believe it should be 
4-1
1-2
3-3
5-4
2-5

Because of the result of the spine lookup, a destination VTEP address is resolved. Then, the packet will be forwarded based on dIPo, which is the address that the spine resolved. The packet reaches the destination VTEP, encapsulated and sent out of the fabric.

discussion.content:
Step 1 Source leaf forwards the packet to anycast TEP encapsulated with VXLAN header
Step 2 Packet is routed in VRF overlay-1 based on dIPo
Step 3 Spine lookup occurs dMACi or dIPi
Step 4 Packet reaches destination leaf and is VXLAN decapsulated
Step 5 Packet is sent out of the fabric

Agree with apot
1 and 2 correct
last 3 in reverse order
https://community.cisco.com/t5/application-centric/glean-in-aci/td-p/4297251

1 and 2 correct
last 3 in reverse order

choices.C: The traffic is flooded using VRF Outer Multicast Group ID.
choices.B: Packets are dropped if dMAC is absent in COOP.
choices.A: The source leaf sends the traffic to all ports in BD.
choices.D: Traffic is flooded to all Layer 2 ports of ACI fabric.

questions.question_text:
//IMG//
Refer to the exhibit. Which method does Cisco ACI fabric use to forward L2 Unknown Unicast packets?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
The L2 Unknown Unicast is set to Flood. So the L2 Unkown Unicast traffic is going to be flooded within the BD. Multi Destination Flooding is for Broadcast and Multicast traffic, it's not related to L2 Unknown Unicast at all.
Think it's C based on the ACI L2 Config guide "When operating in flood mode, Layer 2 unknown unicast traffic is flooded over the multicast tree of the bridge domain (GIPo)"
